message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about the use of a stopwatch. A stopwatch is especially helpful when tracking split times on runs or any activity that requires timing intervals. Option (A) is incorrect because there are other devices like clocks and phones that are more appropriate for ascertaining the current time. Option (C) is also incorrect because alarm clocks are designed for waking up at a specific time, not for tracking intervals. Option (D) is not related to the purpose of a stopwatch, as it is used for measuring time rather than finding answers on a times table test.

This question requires a basic understanding of the uses of a stopwatch. A stopwatch is helpful when tracking split times on runs because it allows the runner to accurately measure their time for each leg or segment of their run. Option (A) is incorrect because a regular clock or watch can be used to ascertain what time it is. Option (C) is incorrect because setting an alarm clock does not require a stopwatch. Option (D) is incorrect because a times table test does not involve timing.

Option (B) is the correct answer because a stopwatch is commonly used to track split times or intervals during a run or any activity where timing is important.
